paragraphs.text:
%md
# About
**Lab:** Hive and HBase
**Objective:** Become familiar with using Hive and Hbase mapped tables
**File locations:** hostname:/tmp/dc hdfs:///data/dc
**Successful outcome:** Understanding Hive and Hbase integration
**Before you begin:** N/A
**Related lessons:** HBase Overview 

---

msg.data:
About

Lab: Hive and HBase
Objective: Become familiar with using Hive and Hbase mapped tables
File locations: hostname:/tmp/dc hdfs:///data/dc
Successful outcome: Understanding Hive and Hbase integration
Before you begin: N/A
Related lessons: HBase Overview

paragraphs.text:
%md
# Setup
This setup will need to be run again

msg.data:
Setup

This setup will need to be run again

paragraphs.title: Get the data from github and store it in HDFS
paragraphs.text:
%sh
rm -r /tmp/dc
mkdir /tmp/dc
wget https://github.com/fivethirtyeight/data/raw/master/comic-characters/dc-wikia-data.csv -O /tmp/dc/dc-wikia-data.csv

paragraphs.title: List the directory /tmp/dc
paragraphs.text:
%sh
ls /tmp/dc

paragraphs.title: Move the data into HDFS /data/dc
paragraphs.text:
%sh
sudo -u hdfs hdfs dfs -rm -r -skipTrash /data/dc
sudo -u hdfs hdfs dfs -mkdir /data/dc
sudo -u hdfs hdfs dfs -put /tmp/dc/dc-wikia-data.csv /data/dc/dc-wikia-data.csv

paragraphs.title: Grant Hive access to the data
paragraphs.text:
%sh
sudo -u hdfs hdfs dfs -chown -R hive /data/dc

paragraphs.title: List the contents of HDFS /data/dc
paragraphs.text:
%sh
hdfs dfs -ls /data/dc

paragraphs.title: Create table for dc_comics
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)

DROP TABLE IF EXISTS dc_comics_stage;

CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE dc_comics_stage ( 
                        page_id string,
                        name string,
                        urlslug string,
                        ID string,
                        ALIGN string,
                        EYE string,
                        HAIR string,
                        SEX string,
                        GSM string,
                        ALIVE string,
                        APPEARANCES string,
                        FIRST_APPEARANCES string,
                        YEAR string
                        ) 
ROW FORMAT DELIMITED
FIELDS TERMINATED BY ',' 
LOCATION '/warehouse/tablespace/external/hive/dc_comics_stage/';

paragraphs.title: Load data into dc_comics_stage
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
LOAD DATA  INPATH '/data/dc/dc-wikia-data.csv' OVERWRITE INTO TABLE dc_comics_stage;

paragraphs.title: Select from the table dc_comics_stage limit 5
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
SELECT * FROM dc_comics_stage LIMIT 5;

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: Log into terminal console to be able to execute hbase queries
paragraphs.text:
%md

* Login to Hbase shell and follow the remaining steps in the notebook.

```console
hbase shell
```

msg.data:
• Login to Hbase shell and follow the remaining steps in the notebook.
hbase shell

paragraphs.text:
%md
# Lab

%md
We are going to create an Hive Hbase managed table
~~~
CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE hbase_dc_comics(
                        page_id string,
                        name string,
                        urlslug string,
                        ID string,
                        ALIGN string,
                        EYE string,
                        HAIR string,
                        SEX string,
                        GSM string,
                        ALIVE string,
                        APPEARANCES int,
                        FIRST_APPEARANCES string,
                        YEAR string
                        )
STORED BY 'org.apache.hadoop.hive.hbase.HBaseStorageHandler'
WITH SERDEPROPERTIES ("hbase.columns.mapping" = "cf1:name,cf1:urlslug,cf1:ID,cf1:ALIGN,cf2:EYE,cf2:HAIR,cf2:SEX,cf2:GSM,cf2:Alive,cf3:Appearances,cf3:first_appeareances,cf3:year")
TBLPROPERTIES ("hbase.table.name" = "hbase_dc", "hbase.mapred.output.outputtable" = "hbase_dc","transactional"="false")
;
~~~

But first we need to drop the table if it already exists.

TBLPROPERTIES ("hbase.table.name" = "hbase_dc", "hbase.mapred.output.outputtable" = "hbase_dc","transactional"="false")
;

But first we need to drop the table if it already exists.

paragraphs.title: 5 - Query the table in HBase using the terminal console
paragraphs.text:
%md
~~~
Describe the table in Hbase.
describe "hbase_dc"

Query the table in Hbase
scan "hbase_dc"

exit

~~~

%md
###Practice SQL

paragraphs.title: 6 - Create another Hive HBase mapped table.

paragraphs.text:
%md
# Result
**You have now:** You have now successfully created a Hive tabled mapped to an HBase table.

---

msg.data:
Result

You have now: You have now successfully created a Hive tabled mapped to an HBase table.

paragraphs.text:
%md
# Solution
---

paragraphs.title: 1 - Drop the table
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS hbase_dc_comics;

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

[{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

[{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: 2 - Create the table
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE hbase_dc_comics(
                        page_id string,
                        name string,
                        urlslug string,
                        ID string,
                        ALIGN string,
                        EYE string,
                        HAIR string,
                        SEX string,
                        GSM string,
                        ALIVE string,
                        APPEARANCES int,
                        FIRST_APPEARANCES string,
                        YEAR string
                        )
STORED BY 'org.apache.hadoop.hive.hbase.HBaseStorageHandler'
WITH SERDEPROPERTIES ("hbase.columns.mapping" = "cf1:name,cf1:urlslug,cf1:ID,cf1:ALIGN,cf2:EYE,cf2:HAIR,cf2:SEX,cf2:GSM,cf2:Alive,cf3:Appearances,cf3:first_appeareances,cf3:year")
TBLPROPERTIES ("hbase.table.name" = "hbase_dc", "hbase.mapred.output.outputtable" = "hbase_dc","transactional"="false")
;

paragraphs.title: 3 - Load the Table with data
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
INSERT OVERWRITE TABLE hbase_dc_comics SELECT * FROM dc_comics_stage;

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

[{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: 4 - Query the Hive Table. Limit 5
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
SELECT * FROM hbase_dc_comics LIMIT 5;

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: 5 - Query the table in HBase using the terminal console
paragraphs.text:
%md
~~~
Login into HBase shell
hbase shell

Describe the table in Hbase.
describe "hbase_dc"

Query the table in Hbase
scan "hbase_dc"

exit

~~~

%md
We hope you've enjoyed this lab. Below are additional resources that you should find useful:

1. [Cloudera Apache Spark Tutorials](http://hortonworks.com/tutorials/#tuts-developers) are your natural next step where you can explore Spark in more depth.
2. [Cloudera Community Connection (HCC)](https://community.hortonworks.com/spaces/85/data-science.html?type=question) is a great resource for questions and answers on Spark, Data Analytics/Science, and many more Big Data topics.
3. [Cloudera Apache Spark Docs](https://docs.hortonworks.com/HDPDocuments/HDP3/HDP-3.0.1/spark-overview/content/analyzing_data_with_apache_spark.html) - official Spark documentation.
4. [Cloudera Apache Zeppelin Docs](https://docs.hortonworks.com/HDPDocuments/HDP3/HDP-3.0.1/zeppelin-overview/content/overview.html) - official Zeppelin documentation.
